title: 103_hr4373
content: The "Social Security COLA Limitation Act of 1994" limits cost-of-living adjustments. The Social Security Act is amended to reduce increases applied to higher primary insurance amounts. The increase percentage is multiplied by specific amounts to determine the increase for primary insurance amounts. The increase for primary insurance amounts is calculated by multiplying specific amounts by the applicable increase percentage. The highest primary insurance amount below the 20th percentile is determined, and each primary insurance amount is reduced to the sum of the amount without any previous reductions and the increase. Any amount not a multiple of $0.10 is decreased to the next lower multiple. The increase for primary insurance amounts is calculated by multiplying specific amounts by the applicable increase percentage. Any amount not a multiple of $0.10 shall be decreased to the next lower multiple of $0.10. Conforming amendments are made to maintain current levels of cost-of-living adjustment under other programs. The amendment specifies how benefit amounts under title II and certain veteran's benefits are increased based on the applicable percentage used for the previous December. The amendment specifies cost-of-living adjustments to benefit amounts under title II and certain veteran's benefits based on the applicable percentage used for the previous December. The Social Security Act is amended to update the section regarding cost-of-living adjustments and the application of regulations for the amendments made in 1994. The amendments made by this Act will apply to adjustments under section 215(i) of the Social Security Act effective after November 1994.
